thread.title: Teammates all in as Locust Grove QB Mason Fine goes for the record
thread.title_full: Teammates all in as Locust Grove QB Mason Fine goes for the record

title: Teammates all in as Locust Grove QB Mason Fine goes for the record
text:
Posted: 8:20 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015 Teammates all in as Locust Grove QB Mason Fine goes for the record ﻿ MIKE SIMONS Locust Grove QB Mason Fine runs the ball in a win over Tahlequah Sequoyah on Oct. 15. Tulsa World Sponsored Links Tulsa World LOCUST GROVE — 
By all accounts, Mason Fine has remained unfazed in his quest to make high school football history. 
The Locust Grove senior quarterback can become the state’s leading career passer when Claremore Sequoyah visits the Pirates at 7 p.m. Friday. 
“He doesn’t say much about it,” linebacker Trevor Taylor said. “I think we’re more excited about it than he his. Everybody wants to be part of something like this.” 
Fine needs 157 yards to surpass Atoka’s L.T. Pfaff, who threw for 11,357 yards over four seasons (2007-10). Fine enters the game with 11,201. Sign up for our FOX23 News This Morning Newsletter Sign Up
